Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery open vase, probably a krater. Upper body and head of a youth, with drapery over left shoulder.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit attributeds the sherd to the Group of Polygnotos
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 103 no. 361 pl. 77)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1106)
